results.title: Harvest of the gulfs
results.creator_credit: John Leake, Peter Dimond, Motion Picture Associates and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This film traces the research being undertaken by the South Australian Department of Fisheries into the life cycle, habitat and movements of the Western King Prawn in the South Australian gulf waters.

results.title: Harvest
results.creator_credit: Carroll Ballard and U.S.A Department of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Farming in the United States: with the population increase more food must be produced even though more land is being taken up for city and urban expansion. The student population is increasing in universities and agricultural colleges where the study of the sciences associated with modern farming are undergoing rapid change. This leads to a reduction of farm problems and bigger yields with the aid of new chemicals and mechanical implements. However, the farmer is still at the mercy of the weather. Culminates in a harvest sequence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carroll Ballard and U.S.A Department of Agriculture

results.title: Growing up female
results.brief_description: This film gives graphic illustration of the kind of conditioning that women undergo in society, in an attempt to examine and question the whole framework of the women’s role. Women from various age-groups are presented, all of them revealing in some degree their mental conditioning. Advertising media are viewed as instrumental in this process. The film raises important questions as to the depth of the problem and the possibilities of liberating women in the present social order.

results.title: God knows why, but it works
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Richard Mason and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The story of the life and work of Dr. Archie Kalokerinos. In nineteen years’ practice as the only doctor in the tiny western New South Wales town of Collarenebri, he has formulated radical treatments to combat the alarming health problems of the district’s Aboriginal population. This dramatised version of his life stars Henry Szeps, Robin Nevin and Peter Cummins.

results.title: Getting it all together
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Mansfield Park Junior Primary School is the locale for this film which emphasizes the usefulness and value of community involvement in the school. Two dozen mothers tell what it means to them to be part of Mansfield Park. In breaking down the barriers that often still exist between the community and the school, Mansfield Park encourages High School students to visit weekly. There is an exchange of learning. The students are told about the understanding of children between 2 and 5 year and the students in turn help with youngsters with their puzzles and paintings.

results.title: A Geometry lesson
results.creator_credit: Virgilio Sabel, Carlo Ponti and Lux Film
results.brief_description: This Italian art film traces a relationship between the shapes of nature and the modern sculpture of the Henry Moore school. The film considers the geometrical lines of nature - the shapes and lines of the human body, the structure of crystals and the spiral lines of a snail’s shell - a combination of calculation and creative impulse. Art, by dint of instinct, approaches nature’s examples, thus widening the range of our eyes and our minds. (Award: Venice)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Virgilio Sabel, Carlo Ponti and Lux Film

results.title: General principles
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Nicholas Cockram, Slater Sound Studios and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Conditioning for Sport”.
Gives an insight into some of the specific exercises and conditioning techniques necessary for the athlete to achieve his best. Illustrates various sports with particular emphasis on track and field events.

results.title: Gas welding equipment
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Gas Welding”.
Part one of a series of nine short instructional films showing methods for oxyacetylene welding from setting-up procedures through flame adjustments. Shows types of welds, cutting methods and closing down procedures. Close-up viewing of the equipment and materials being worked gives the learner an operator’s perspective into the art of oxyacetylene welding.

results.title: Future shock
results.creator_credit: Alex Grasshoff and Metro Media Corporation
results.brief_description: Examines the current phenomenon of future shock, the condition which results from too much change too fast. Current technological developments are presented through interviews with scientists. The film echoes Alvin Toffler’s questioning of whether or not change is necessary, and if it is out of control.
